Summary - Active DOC Security Clearance 
 
My goal is to continue to expand my knowledge in the computer security field. I've worked in law enforcement for about 5 years before returning back to school to obtain my degree in computer security which I received May 2013. This field is of interest to me because it will allow me to fight crime on a different level than I have previously. I have had a close personal relationship with the community. Previous jobs required me to work with and locate violent offenders. Most of my experience is face to face, and while I have found that to be rewarding in its own right, crime has taken on a whole new turn. I have been working in the area of Intrusion Detection for the last 2 years. While I enjoy my work, I would like to progress from this area and begin working on the forensic aspect. I am intrigued and excited by the idea of searching through a system or network and figuring out the best way to detect, quarantine and stop a threat from continuing to spread. I have seen multiple infections spread through a network and have assisted in tracking and collecting data on these infections. My goal is to become a vital part of removing these infections and to assist in setting up networks to deter them. Summary - Active DOC Security Clearance

Summary Certified and accredited with a Masters in Information Security from NSA-approved Norwich University, with over 25 years continuous experience in networking and security. Organized and self-motivated, results-driven professional with excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as leadership and project management skills. Diversified background in federal, state, local, and private industries covering various technologies from Cisco, Checkpoint, Microsoft, VMware, Citrix, Barracuda, Sonicwall, SourceFire, Nessus, 3COM, HP, Novell, IBM, Alcatel, Nortel, Network Associates, Secure Computing, CyberGuard, Nokia, RSA, and Motorola. Subject matter expertise in networking technologies, virtualization, storage (SAN/NAS), information security and assurance, auditing, policy, procedure, and standards development, firewalls, vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, intrusion detection and prevention (IDS/IPS), cloud architectures, high-availability architectures, VPNs, LAN and WAN design, installation, troubleshooting, and optimization, UNIX, LINUX, and Windows systems administration, system hardening, consulting, project management, product and service sales, new business development, pre-sales engineering, presentations, and training. 
 
Specialties: Current areas of expertise include Cisco UCS and Data Center technologies along with VMware vSphere v4.x and v5.x virtual infrastructure solutions. Checkpoint and Cisco firewall and boundary defense solution designs, installation, configuration, and administration, including comprehensive security management, monitoring, migrations, and upgrades. 
 
Other areas of expertise include network health and network security assessments, information assurance and security awareness best practices including ITIL and other IT best practice areas.
